Description: Round-topped limestone stela of Senusretseneb divided into three registers: 1 - Two wedjat-eyes. 2 - Three rows of Hieroglyphic text. 3 - Scene of the deceased seated before an offering table and three kneeling daughters(different levels).
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p.39 [4]. Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, Japan 1999-2000, [20].
Bibliographic references: Hall 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 3. (pl.25)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces 2002, St Albans, Life and Death
